metadata.synopsis: Laezel discusses what happened with Voss.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Available after the Voss Camp Confrontation night after Creche

8.speaker: Lae'zel
8.context:
NodeContext: CHK-ill VOSS VLAH-kith mm zah-THOCK!

Just killed Voss, who she believes is a traitor to her people and her queen. Somewhat vehement, but not too much so. His death is a tragedy in its own right.

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: The traitor is dead. Zai, zai, zai!
90.context:
NodeContext: ZYE (like eye or rye)

Just killed Voss, who she believes is a traitor to her people and her queen. Somewhat vehement, but not too much so. His death is a tragedy in its own right.

52.speaker: Player
52.context:
NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

zhe-STIL heh-SHAR-lock

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: Voss was a heretic. You can no more extinguish the Undying Queen than you can the constellations.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: Voss was a heretic. You can no more stand against Vlaakith's will than you can extinguish the sun.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: One traitor, yes. But there is another in Baldur's Gate, at this Sharess' Caress.
38.context:
NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

zhe-STIL heh-SHAR-lock

39.speaker: Lae'zel
39.text: Then I will gut them too, and present their head to Vlaakith.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: One traitor, yes. But there are more out there, surely.
113.context:
NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

zhe-STIL heh-SHAR-lock

22.speaker: Lae'zel
22.text: Then I will gut them all and present their heads to Vlaakith.
22.context:
NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

zhe-STIL heh-SHAR-lock

3.speaker: Lae'zel
3.text: My queen - by the dead of night and the red of blood, I have felled Voss, Jhe'stil Hshar'lak, the traitor supreme.
3.context:
NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

zhe-STIL heh-SHAR-lock

91.speaker: Lae'zel
91.text: I will go to Baldur's Gate and punish the one who holds the means of your fall.
91.context: NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

7.speaker: Lae'zel
7.text: This is how I will regain your favour.
7.context: NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: I have honoured the ten-thousand protocols. I will ascend.
35.context: NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Who do you think is the Prism's occupant, this 'seed of Vlaakith's demise'?
112.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident

79.speaker: Lae'zel
79.text: I can't say. What matters is that they are a threat to Queen Vlaakith.

58.speaker: Lae'zel
58.text: As is Voss' contact in the city. Together, they would be the end of an empire, and the rise of the ghaik.

97.speaker: Lae'zel
97.text: And like any threat, it must be eliminated. We must find a way.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Will Vlaakith stop hunting us, now that Voss is dead?
54.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident

84.speaker: Lae'zel
84.text: The truth is bound to reach her ears. I don't yet know when or how.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: We must tell Vlaakith of Voss' betrayal.
115.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident

47.speaker: Lae'zel
47.text: So we will. Though I don't yet know when or how.
47.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident

75.speaker: Lae'zel
75.text: Until then, her warriors will hunt us. If they can't see reason, they'll see the gleam of a blade as it severs their necks.
75.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: Protect yourself. For now, we've no other choice - when she hears the truth, Vlaakith will absolve us.
24.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident

73.speaker: Player
73.text: What if we're wrong? Could Vlaakith really consume her own people?
73.context: NodeContext: Slightly annoyed at the suggestion she could be wrong, but ONLY just slightly.

89.speaker: Lae'zel
89.context: NodeContext: Slightly annoyed at the suggestion she could be wrong, but ONLY just slightly.

31.speaker: Lae'zel
31.text: Ascension is a young githyanki's greatest honour, not this... this craven conspiracy Voss tried to poison us with.
31.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief, and a bit taken back by the suggestion Vlaakith could consume her own people.

111.speaker: Lae'zel
111.text: From the day of our hatching, young gith have one purpose: to train hard enough to slay a ghaik and take its head.
111.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief, and a bit taken back by the suggestion Vlaakith could consume her own people.

44.speaker: Lae'zel
44.text: Then we speak the Rite of Ascension, and a red dragon comes to fly us to Vlaakith in Tu'narath, City of Death.
44.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief, and a bit taken back by the suggestion Vlaakith could consume her own people.

36.speaker: Lae'zel
36.text: We are honoured with an eternal home in the Astral, not devoured by our queen like meat at the feast table.
36.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief, and a bit taken back by the suggestion Vlaakith could consume her own people.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: If Vlaakith isn't a tyrant, why would Voss want her dead?
43.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

9.speaker: Lae'zel
9.text: At first, I thought he might crave power and control.

59.speaker: Lae'zel
59.text: The reins to a thousand dragons and the helms of a thousand spelljammer vessels.

74.speaker: Lae'zel
74.text: But I fear he sought something even more insidious: to hand the Githyanki Empire to the ghaik.

20.speaker: Lae'zel
20.text: If the Prism's occupant could bring such a horror to pass, I will exterminate them with prejudice.

106.speaker: Player
106.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

5.speaker: Lae'zel
5.text: Ascension is a young githyanki's greatest honour.
5.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: Long ago, the ghaik enslaved my people. They dominated our minds and bred us for war, until great Mother Gith took a hammer to our bonds.
26.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

99.speaker: Lae'zel
99.text: From the day of our hatching, young gith have one purpose: to train hard enough to slay a ghaik and take its head.
99.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

37.speaker: Lae'zel
37.text: Then we speak the Rite of Ascension, and a red dragon comes to fly us to Vlaakith in Tu'narath, City of Death.
37.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: We are honoured with an eternal home in the Astral, celebrated for our victory. We are ascended.
18.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Is Vlaakith really the tyrant Voss thinks she is?

40.speaker: Lae'zel
40.text: A tyrant cracks her whip and eradicates the weak for her own advance.

64.speaker: Lae'zel
64.text: Queen Vlaakith does so to prevent ghaik insurgence.

82.speaker: Lae'zel
82.text: The githyanki are the bulwark preventing illithid advance across the sixteen planes. One crack, and the bulwark collapses.

33.speaker: Lae'zel
33.text: The Undying Queen is ruthless because she has to be. Thanks to her, we endure. All of us.

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: Very well - we know our task. Find Voss' contact in Baldur's Gate. They hold the key to setting the Prism's dweller loose.

77.speaker: Lae'zel
77.text: That key could mean Vlaakith's end - and that of my people.

17.speaker: Player
17.context:
NodeContext: ZYE (like eye or rye)

Just killed Voss, who she believes is a traitor to her people and her queen. Somewhat vehement, but not too much so. His death is a tragedy in its own right.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Repeat the chant, but with particular vigour.
13.context:
NodeContext: ZYE (like eye or rye)

Just killed Voss, who she believes is a traitor to her people and her queen. Somewhat vehement, but not too much so. His death is a tragedy in its own right.

72.speaker: Lae'zel
72.text: Zai! Your cry is worthy - let it roil the Astral Sea!
72.context:
NodeContext: ZYE (like eye or rye)

Just killed Voss, who she believes is a traitor to her people and her queen. Somewhat vehement, but not too much so. His death is a tragedy in its own right.

105.speaker: Lae'zel
105.text: 'Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.'
105.context:
NodeContext: Thoughtful, remembering what she was taught.

VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het.

0.speaker: Lae'zel
0.text: These were the first words I ever read on tir'su slate.

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: But they are no mere aphorism. They are law, they are creed - the root from which the ten-thousand protocols stem.
1.context: NodeContext: 'I have not sinned against Vlaakith - she has sinned against ME.'

96.speaker: Lae'zel
96.text: 'Forsake one protocol, and forsake Vlaakith. Forsake Vlaakith, and be the blood and meat which sates her dragons.'
96.context: NodeContext: 'I have not sinned against Vlaakith - she has sinned against ME.'

98.speaker: Lae'zel
98.text: If Voss speaks true - if ascension is a lie, if tadpole purification is a fairy tale, then I have not sinned against Vlaakith...
98.context: NodeContext: 'I have not sinned against Vlaakith - she has sinned against ME.'

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.context: NodeContext: 'I have not sinned against Vlaakith - she has sinned against ME.'

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Could Vlaakith have been lying about the prince from the stories, too?

46.speaker: Lae'zel
46.text: Orpheus, the Prince of the Comet. Traitor to the empire, ghaik asset - and long dead. So it is inscribed in the protocols.

80.speaker: Lae'zel
80.text: If I must question one protocol, I must question them all. Including every history I've read of Gith's Son, the so-called traitor prince.

68.speaker: Lae'zel
68.text: Ascension is a young githyanki's greatest honour.

93.speaker: Lae'zel
93.text: Long ago, the ghaik enslaved my people. They dominated our minds and bred us for war, until great Mother Gith took a hammer to our bonds.

100.speaker: Lae'zel
100.text: From the day of our hatching, young gith have one purpose: to train hard enough to slay a ghaik and take its head.

10.speaker: Lae'zel
10.text: Then we speak the Rite of Ascension, and a red dragon comes to fly us to Vlaakith in Tu'narath, City of Death.

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: We are honoured with an eternal home in the Astral, celebrated for our victory. We are ascended. Or so I believed.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Voss called Vlaakith a tyrant. Does this mean you agree?

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: I'd never thought Vlaakith a tyrant, or me as a vassal. She was the source of my might, and I the envoy of her will.

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: A warrior. A champion. A destroyer.

109.speaker: Lae'zel
109.text: But if Voss is right, and Vlaakith consumes the ascended to gain power...

28.speaker: Lae'zel
28.text: Then I am no destroyer. I am mere livestock, bred to be harvested and devoured.

50.speaker: Lae'zel
50.text: Every githyanki is a slave with a singular purpose. Not to cull the ghaik, not to prevent their Grand Design -

61.speaker: Lae'zel
61.text: - but to raise Vlaakith to true godhood.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Who is the one in the Prism, do you think?

110.speaker: Lae'zel
110.text: I don't know. I can't know. And that drives me mad.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: At first, I thought them an illithid deception, a trick of the tadpole.

104.speaker: Lae'zel
104.text: But the dream figure is real. It lives in the Prism.

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: Voss believes they are the seed of Vlaakith's demise and the agent of githyanki freedom.

88.speaker: Lae'zel
88.text: And I believe he may be right.

23.speaker: Lae'zel
23.text: But Voss believes they are the seed of Vlaakith's demise and the agent of githyanki freedom.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: And if Voss is wrong? If his claims are wrong and Vlaakith's are real?

19.speaker: Lae'zel
19.text: Then when the kith'raki come for me - and come, they will - I will submit to their blades.

27.speaker: Lae'zel
27.text: They would feed me to their dragons. And I would deserve no better.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Obviously. It's about time you figured it out.

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: Obvious, you say. But does the dragon of the sky ever look to the worm, and dream of crawling?

71.speaker: Lae'zel
71.text: I was taught but one way, the superior way. Vlaakith's way.

49.speaker: Lae'zel
49.text: Until now, I never thought Vlaakith a tyrant or me as a vassal. She was the source of my might, and I the envoy of her will.

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: A warrior. A champion. A destroyer.

87.speaker: Lae'zel
87.text: Yes. I'd like time to think.

81.speaker: Lae'zel
81.text: We'll meet Kith'rak Voss at Sharess' Caress, in Baldur's Gate. Until then, be vigilant. Vlaakith's eyes are upon us.
